content: fluff up using your wire brush and trim into shape ears make 2 chain 3 single_crochet in second chain from hook single_crochet double_crochet chain 2 single_crochet in back bump of second chain from hook double_crochet single_crochet all in last chain single_crochet in back of starting chain pinch the sides of the base of the ear together and sew on to the head make your own variations why not make an angora by pulling yarn through the entire head and body a flemish giant by doubling the yarn or using a thicker yarn a new zealand white by making a white pink eyed rabbit with pink ears or an american fuzzy lop by giving the jersey wooly lop ears you could also embroider a little nose and mouth using embroidery thread you can make an even smaller rabbit by using crochet thread too © laura s pixie patch 13 congratulations on finishing your baby rabbit you are welcome to give away and sell rabbits made from my pattern please credit me laura gillard or laura s pixie patch as the designer you may not give away share or sell copies of my pattern or use my photographs as your own
